trans-unit.source: it will emit an error. This is because queries can be built dynamically, and therefore passing nil can lead to security errors. However, the :where values for an association are given at compile-time, which is less dynamic and cannot leverage the full power of Ecto queries, which explains why they have different APIs.
keyword lists - each keyword list is expected to have the keys :key and :value. Additional keys such as :disabled may be given to customize the option

matches /pages/hello/world and puts the globbed segments in params["page"].
matches /pages/hello and dispatches to the show action with %{"page" => "hello"} in params.
matches a GET request to /pages and dispatches it to the index action in PageController.

trans-unit.source: router (Phoenix.Router) - the router is responsible for dispatching verb/path to controllers. The router also allows us to scope functionality. For example, some pages in your application may require user authentication, others may not

send_file(payload, arg2, arg3, file, offset, length)
show - renders an individual item by id
template engine - a module that receives a template path and transforms its source code into Elixir quoted expressions
template name - is the name of the template as given by the user, without the template engine extension, for example: "users.html"
template path - is the complete path of the template in the filesystem, for example, "path/to/users.html.eex"
template root - the directory where templates are defined

the app layout - this is the default application layout which is not included or used by LiveViews. It defaults to "app.html.eex" in your MyAppWeb.LayoutView.
the header key contains uppercase chars

the live layout - this is the layout which wraps a LiveView and is rendered as part of the LiveView life-cycle. It must be opt-in by passing the :layout option on use Phoenix.LiveView. It is typically set to "live.html.leex"in your MyAppWeb.LayoutView.
the module name of a Phoenix endpoint (shown above) - where the secret key base is extracted from the endpoint
trans-unit.target: имя модуля конечной точки Феникса (показано выше)-где секретная база ключей извлекается из конечной точки

the query has bad utf-8 encoding
the reason (an exception for errors or a term for others)
trans-unit.target: причина (исключение для ошибок или термин для других)

trans-unit.source: the root layout - this is a layout used by both LiveView and regular views. This layout typically contains the <html> definition alongside the head and body tags. Any content defined in the root layout will remain the same, even as you live navigate across LiveViews. All LiveViews defined at the router must have a root layout. The root layout is typically declared on the router with put_root_layout and defined as "root.html.eex" in your MyAppWeb.LayoutView. It may also be given via the the :layout option to the router's live macro.
the scheme of the endpoint :http or :https
the second argument is the exit reason, which follows the same behaviour as standard GenServer exits.
trans-unit.target: второй аргумент - причина выхода, которая следует тому же поведению, что и стандартный выход GenServer .

trans-unit.source: will send the following map of params to the server:
with changeset data - when information to populate the form comes from a changeset
trans-unit.target: с данными changeset-когда информация для заполнения формы поступает из changeset.

trans-unit.source: with connection data - when a form is created based on the information in the connection (aka Plug.Conn)
trans-unit.target: с данными соединения - когда форма создается на основе информации в соединении (aka Plug.Conn )

trans-unit.source: with limited data - when a form is created without an underlying data layer. In this scenario, you can use the connection information (aka Plug.Conn.params) or pass the form values by hand
without form data - when the functions are used directly, outside of a form
trans-unit.target: без данных формы-когда функции используются непосредственно,вне формы
